item.title: Vitamin D, DHA, Folic, Iodine benefits during pregnancy
item.description:
Benefits of Docosahexaenoic Acid, Folic Acid, Vitamin D and Iodine on Foetal and Infant Brain Development and Function Following Maternal Supplementation during Pregnancy and Lactation

Nutrients 2012 July; 4(7): 799–840.. doi: 10.3390/nu4070799

Nancy L. Morse

PMCID: PMC3407995

Scientific literature is increasingly reporting on dietary deficiencies in many populations of some nutrients critical for foetal and infant brain development and function.

Purpose: To highlight the potential benefits of maternal supplementation with docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) and other important complimentary nutrients, including vitamin D, folic acid and iodine during pregnancy and/or breast feeding for foetal and/or infant brain development and/or function.

item.title: Obesity epidemic: a perfect storm of deficiency of vitamin D, Magnesium, Iodine, etc
item.description:
See also VitaminDWiki

  • Low vitamin D in womb linked to more weight at age 6 – May 2012

It appears that low vitamin D while in womb provides an epigenetic signal that the child should prepare for an environment with low nutrients, such as vitamin D.

The body is thus programmed to seek out and store up as much nutrients/food as it can, which leads to health when food is rare, but obesity when food is plentiful.

item.title: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis and Vitamin D - multiple studies
item.description:
Most studies agree: Hashimoto’s Thyroiditis is associated with low Vitamin D

H vs H

HASHIMOTO’S: IS IT A THYROID PROBLEM OR AN IMMUNE PROBLEM?

      • Hashimoto’s thyroiditis meta-analysis (only 3 RCTs used Vitamin D3) - Jan 2024
      • Hashimoto’s thyroiditis and vitamin D - meta-analysis - Dec 2021
      • Those with Hashimoto’s thyroiditis are 3.2 X more likely to have <20 ng - meta-analysis April 2020
      • Vitamin D supplementation (1200-4000 IU) reduced HT - Sept 2015
      • Hashimoto’s Thyroiditis 2.3X more likely if low vitamin D - June 2015
      • 92% of Hashimoto’s patients had Vitamin D deficiency - Jan 2015
      • Relative Vitamin D Insufficiency in Hashimoto’s Thyroiditis (2011)
      • Hashimoto’s autoimmune thyroiditis and vitamin D deficiency. Current aspects. (Feb 2014)
      • Risk of Hashimoto’s Thyroiditis reduced 19 percent for each 5 ng increase in vitamin D – March 2014
      • No difference in Frequency of Hashimoto’s thyroiditis with Vitamin D level in Turkey - 2014
      • Hypothyroidism And Hashimoto’s Thyroiditis - book 2013 - includes Vitamin D
      • Low vitamin D status is associated with hypothyroid Hashimoto’s thyroiditis. - July 2016
      • Vitamin D levels of Autoimmune Thyroiditis are low in winter increaase over the years - Nov 2019
      • Hashimoto’s thyroiditis has some assocation with poor Vitamin D Receptor - May 2021
      • HT: Importance of Vitamin D, Iodine, Selenium, and Gluten - April 2017
      • HT treated by Selenium better than by Vitamin D - meta-analysis Dec 2024
